text: Purna Swaraj, or "total independence," was a document written by the Indian National Congress session at Lahore, Punjab The Former Capital of the Undivided Punjab in December 19, 1929. It said that India should be separate from the British Empire. Purna Swaraj was announced on January 26, 1930. This is one reason why January 26 is India's Republic Day. The Purna Swaraj was 750 words long. Scholars such as Mithi Mukherjee say it was an important part of Indian independence because it said becoming independent was about justice. ==Related pages== *Declaration of Independence ==References== Category:20th century in India Category:1929
title: Purna Swaraj
